snippet: A court sentenced Nabeel Rajab, a prominent human rights activist, to two years in a case that has exposed the government to international criticism.
abstract: Bahrain court upholds conviction and prison sentence of human rights activist Nabeel Rajab, reducing his sentence to two years from three, in case that exposed government to international criticism and was seen as crucial test of monarchy’s repeated pledges to allow greater political freedom.
lead_paragraph: A court sentenced Nabeel Rajab, a prominent human rights activist, to two years in a case that has exposed the government to international criticism.

headline.main: Activist’s Conviction Upheld in Test of Pledges by Bahrain
headline.print_headline: Activist’s Conviction Upheld In Test of Pledges by Bahrain
